summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between Gary Stein, a partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The emails primarily concern scheduling calls and the prosecutor's inquiry into whether the Professional Children's School (PCS) has records of third-party payments, donations, or scholarships from 1997-2000 related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: The primary correspondent, a lawyer who is being contacted by the U.S. Attorney's office regarding records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is copied on emails and is involved in the inquiry regarding records from the Professional Children's School.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the financial records inquiry, specifically regarding potential third-party payments, donations, or scholarships at the Professional Children's School between 1997 and 2000.

connections.description: Correspondence between a private attorney and a federal prosecutor regarding a records inquiry related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
Stein, as a lawyer, is being asked by prosecutors to help locate or confirm the existence of financial records related to Epstein at the Professional Children's School.
Sullivan, as an AUSA, is investigating Epstein's potential financial transactions, specifically payments to the Professional Children's School.

events.title: Period of Financial Inquiry
events.description: The time period for which the U.S. Attorney's office is seeking records of third-party payments, donations, or scholarships related to Jeffrey Epstein at the Professional Children's School.

events.title: Prosecutor's Detailed Records Request
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a detailed email to Gary Stein asking if the Professional Children's School has records of third-party payments, donations, or scholarships related to Jeffrey Epstein from 1997-2000.

events.title: Scheduling of Trial Prep Calls
events.description: A series of emails throughout 2021 where Gary Stein and the prosecutor's office schedule and reschedule calls, noting that a trial is 'coming up soon'.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was investigating whether Jeffrey Epstein made third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships at the Professional Children's School between 1997 and 2000.
Gary Stein, a partner at the law firm Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, acted as a point of contact for the prosecution regarding records from the Professional Children's School.
The email chain indicates an ongoing investigation and preparation for a trial related to Epstein as of 2021.
The prosecutor's inquiry specifically sought records not covered by an initial subpoena, indicating a follow-up or expanded line of investigation.
The correspondence is heavily redacted, with the primary prosecutor's name and email addresses obscured, though Elizabeth Sullivan is copied.
